body:
This is expected behaviour â€” prerendered pages always take priority over dynamic endpoints. The reason for that is that in most environments (Vercel included) there isn't even an opportunity to run SvelteKit if a matching file exists on the filesystem. The 405 you're seeing is coming from Vercel itself, which sees a request for `/bob`, sees that there's a matching `bob/index.html` file already prerendered, then says 'hang on a minute, you can't POST to a prerendered file'.

So you'll always need to disable prerendering for these pages. We could probably do a better job of diagnosing this at build time â€” if a page is shadowed by an endpoint, prerendering should fail. (When we implement #3532, we can change that to 'if a page is shadowed by an endpoint with non-GET handlers'.)

Hi @Rich-Harris  - thanks for the detailed update, makes total sense. At least a got a decent error message from Vercel (the 405). When I deployed to Cloudflare (when I had no idea what caused the issue), I simply got no response at all ðŸ˜±

Would be great with a simple check that caused the build/serve to fail.

rename.from: Deploying to Vercel can cause http error 405 when there is a prerendered route next to a POST method
rename.to: Fail prerendering if a page is shadowed by an endpoint

@benmccann 

Can also take this one if you give me the go-ahead.

@Rich-Harris

I was looking into this one, and I think you can just close it.

In the `prerendering/basics` test project, there's [already a test](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/39eaf0905f28c55ba7ee3fe9ba67ec487290a6b2/packages/kit/test/prerendering/basics/test/test.js#L71) verifying this behavior. The only reason the project can even build is because `continueOnError === true` for the test project. If it weren't, you'd see the error `'Cannot prerender pages that have endpoints with mutative methods'` thrown from [this line](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/39eaf0905f28c55ba7ee3fe9ba67ec487290a6b2/packages/kit/src/runtime/server/page/load_node.js#L408) and build would fail.

So I think this one's a freebie. :)

Looking into it a bit further, the only case in which this doesn't work is when running in dev (because the current condition only checks `state.prerender`). If we wanted it to throw when running the dev server, we could change [this line](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/39eaf0905f28c55ba7ee3fe9ba67ec487290a6b2/packages/kit/src/runtime/server/page/load_node.js#L61) to `node.module.prerender ?? state?.prerender?.default ?? false`. `prerender` isn't used anywhere else inside of `load_shadow_data`, so it won't cause any unexpected behavior. All tests still pass (I checked). If we want to make that change, I'm happy to open a PR.

Personally, I would advocate for that change, as I _hate_ getting slapped in the face by buildtime errors when they could've been caught during dev runtime.
Thanks for taking a look @tcc-sejohnson. I agree it's better to fail during dev when possible if an error state is encountered

issue.title: feat: Fail prerendering for pages with mutative endpoints - fixes #3410 and #4252
issue.body:
There are a few issues up around the confusing things that happen if a page is prerendered with mutative methods. Thankfully, this already errors at buildtime. However, it can be a bit of a footgun during development, as there's no warning what you're doing isn't valid until you try to build.

Added tests to make sure that, if a page should be prerendered (both a build-time and at runtime), it fails to do so with a descriptive message.

Fixes #3410 and fixes #4252.
